New Records: Bradley Beal came off the bench for the first time in nine years and scored 25 points as the Phoenix Suns ended a four-game skid with a 109-99 win over the Philadelphia 76ers on Monday night.
The Phoenix Suns' bench outscored the Philadelphia 76ers' reserves 54-7.
The Suns shot 14-for-30 (46.7%) from beyond the arc, led by three 3s each from Durant, Beal, and Dunn.
Key Match Events: Phoenix went on a 25-6 run in the third quarter, turning a seven-point deficit into a 12-point lead that was too much for Philadelphia to overcome.
Bradley Beal scored 20 points in the second half as the Suns overcame an early 12-point deficit.
Pre-Game Insights: Phoenix coach Mike Budenholzer took longtime starters Bradley Beal and Jusuf Nurkic out of the lineup and had them come off the bench.
The Suns trailed after the first quarter for the fifth consecutive game but their bench outscored Philadelphia's reserves 54-7.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns ended a four-game skid with a win, and the 76ers fell to 7-14 without Joel Embiid.
Tyrese Maxey had 31 points and 10 assists for the Sixers, who were missing Joel Embiid, who was sidelined with a left foot sprain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia turned to Guerschon Yabusele to pick up some of the offensive slack from the center position. Yabusele finished with 14 points and 10 rebounds.
The game was a significant milestone for Bradley Beal, who came off the bench for the first time in nine years.
Others: The Suns wrapped up a three-game trip in Charlotte on Tuesday, while the 76ers hosted Washington on Wednesday.
